chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+)
Homicide by Use of Vehicle w/ PAC (2nd+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Thiefs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intox Use of Vehicle (2nd+), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Thiefs to 23 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 15 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentences in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--to pay $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $56.74 in blood testing costs

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with any known drug offender except in treatment,and except for incidental contact for employment and education as approved by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

supervisions.notes:
--Revocation of driving privileges for 5 years
--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 5 year period

--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Jefferson County Victim impact panel attendance

records.addlTxt:
case called at 10:05am.
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena O Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck and ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Beck
Robert Glick, father of the victim, makes a statement.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.
Sentencing arguments given by  Attorney Zarwell.
Mr. Thiefs makes a statement.

The Court sentences Mr. Thiefs to 23 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 8  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 15 years.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, consecutive to any other sentences in being.

The Court finds that Mr. Thiefs is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Thiefs is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives 118 days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and the approval of the Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--no contact with any known drug offender except in treatment,and except for incidental contact for employment and education as approved by the Agent
--to submit to random urinalyses or other drug testing as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay fine of $400 plus costs, plus the $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay $56.74 in blood testing costs

The Court orders outright (not as conditions of E.S.) 
--Revocation of driving privileges for 5 years
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Jefferson County Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 5 year period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Body armor prohibition warnings/penalties given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 11:00am.
Criminal Case Settlement with attached prior conviction information
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2014 at 10:00 am.

case called at 1:48pm. 
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck and ADA Brookellen Teuber appear for the State of Wisconsin.

The charge and maximum penalties in Count #1 are recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated, including as to the date of the prior conviction; victim rights compliance verified (the State files a victim impact statement); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Thiefs guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On stipulation of the parties, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3.
On Motion of the State, the Court revokes bond. 
recess 1:56pm.  

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing on May 5th at 10:00am
Status conference on March 31, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

case called at 9:45am. 
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Zarwell indicates that the parties had a Pretrial Conference and the Defense received the State's plea offer. The Defense intends to make a counter-off. Attorney Zarwell requests that another Status Conference be scheduled in a couple of weeks. 
recess 9:49am. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (possible Plea Hearing) on March 31st at 1:30pm.
Status conference on March 18, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 26, 2014 at 09:00 am.

case called at 10:20am. 
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Information admitted; the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
Attorney Zarewell requests that a Status Conference be scheduled shortly after the Pretrial date. 
recess 10:24am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/26/14 at 9:00am (2) schedule Status Conference shortly after the Pretrial date

case called at 11:10am. 
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell.  ADA Brookellen Teuber and ADA Theresa Beck appear for the State of Wisconsin; the appearance of the State's Court Officer Detective Kevin Dobreiner is noted.

Mr. Thiefs waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
ADA Teuber requests scheduling of Arraignment on a date as far out within the thirty day time limit as possible.  
During a discussion about possibly having Arraignment earlier due to Mr. Thiefs being in custody, ADA Teuber indicates that she is still awaiting multiple reports including the toxicology report and the autopsy report.

ADA Teuber indicates that the State is withdrawing the State's Motion to Modify Bond, though it may raise the motion again. 
recess 11:16am. 

NEXT: schedule Arraignment within thirty days, but as far out within that time limit as possible
Preliminary hearing on January 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Case called at1:31 pm
Defendant Matthew J. Thiefs in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Theresa Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $25,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-Not to operate any motor vehicle of any kind
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-No possession or consumption of any alcoholic beverages or controlled substances
-No contact with any family members of Kyle Glueck 
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees. Upon posting of cash bail defendant will make arrangments for installation of the SCRAM bracelet by calling the Clerk of Courts Office to determine the next available date and time for installation. Defendant must contact Clerk of Courts Office immediately upon release, if this is after hours defendant is to make contact with the Clerk of Courts Office the next business day at 8:00 am. Once date and time for installation have been set by the Clerk of Courts Office, the defendant will report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse.

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. (requested by the Defense)

Recess: 1:50 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 1/14/14 at 11:00 am
